pullRequest.title: [Enhancement] Change submit button to also save serverside
pullRequest.bodyText:
Checklist

 I tested all changes and all related features with different users (student, tutor, instructor, admin) on the test server https://artemistest.ase.in.tum.de.
 Server: I added multiple integration tests (Spring) related to the features
 Client: I updated multiple integration tests (Jest) related to the features

Motivation and Context


When clicking submit in the online editor with unsaved changes, a save request is issues before the commit request. This may lead to wrong behaviour in some edge cases with bad / no internet connection.
Description

The 'save' and 'submit' actions are now handled in one request. The saveChangedFiles request does now optionally also
commit the changes, depending on a query parameter.
Steps for Testing


Log in to Artemis
Navigate to a programming exercise
Commit with and without unsaved changes
Check that everything works correctly
Inspect the network requests to be only one for saving and committing.

Test also in the instructor editor with all repositories (Test, Solution, Template, ...)

commit.message: edit code-editor-student-container to use new standalone component

make grid-resize event explicit
(todo: remove resize service)
remove unused resize bits from code-editor-instructions
refactor exam-code-editor-student-container to use new code-editor-container component
refactor exam-code-editor-instructor-container to use new code-editor-container component
change submit button to save on server
move file update logic to fix commit error
add integration tests for test repository

nodes.bodyText: Why do you pass this as a String? I think we should use Boolean instead. Alternatively you could leave it as a string and map it into a Boolean value afterwards
I would suggest to compare a Boolean here
